name: Sunday Brunch: Sardine Sandwiches with Tomato Jam and Fresh Cheese
description: [Robin Bellinger] This deliciously unusual sandwich comes from Clotilde Dusoulier's Chocolate and Zucchini—the book, not the blog! Making your own tomato condiment may sound a bit fussy, but it’s actually very little trouble (and, more important, totally worth it). Although...
recipeIngredient: 2 small shallots, minced (onion will do in a pinch)
1 14-ounce can whole tomatoes, drained and chopped
1 tin sardines packed in olive oil, about 4 ounces; I prefer skinless and boneless here
1/4 cup fresh goat cheese, ricotta, or cream cheese
1 packed cup arugula (or mixed greens or baby spinach)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallots and garlic and cook for 2 minutes, until soft and fragrant, stirring regularly. Add the tomatoes, pimentón, salt, pepper, and sugar. Lower the heat to medium-low and cook for 30 minutes, uncovered, stirring from time to time, until the mixture is thick and the juices have evaporated. Transfer to a bowl to cool. (This can be prepared up to a day in advance.)
Drain the sardines and mash roughly with a fork. Slice the crusts off the bread and discard or save for bread crumbs. Toast the slices until golden brown.
Build the sandwiches: toast, cheese, tomato jam, sardines, arugula, toast. Use a sharp bread knife to halve diagonally.
